newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: First Maryland Q2 earnings rise 10 pct.
newsitem.headline: First Maryland Q2 earnings rise 10 pct.

text.p: 3 months to June 1997 3 months to June 1996
NOTE - First Maryland Bancorp is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Allied Irish Banks Plc. It said earnings in the first half were up 11.7 percent on the first half of 1996 at $69.9 million.

Highlights of its first half performance were strong loan growth, which was up 13 percent on the year-earlier period, and an increase in the net interest margin which rose by 12 basis points to 4.37 percent, the bank said.

Other features included a nine percent increase in deposits, notably in commercial transaction accounts driven by sales of FMB's cash management services, and a 14 percent increase in non-interest income, assisted by a 25 percent increase in advisory and trust business.

Provisions for credit losses increased as a result of higher credit card charge offs but the bank said the level of charge offs in the credit card book was broadly in line with the experience of other banks at 6.8 percent.
First Maryland said it now looked forward to realising the benefits of its enlarged franchise following completion of its merger with Dauphin Deposit Corp.
